docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14-- The Cuban delegation walked out of the Council of the Organization of American States today before the Council could act to exclude Cuba from participation in the affairs of the organization.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 14-- The Cuban delegation walked out of the Council of the Organization of American States today before the Council could act to exclude Cuba from participation in the affairs of the organization.

headline.main: CUBA WALKS OUT AS O.A.S. COUNCIL FORMALIZES BAN; Declares Exclusion Illegal-- U.S. Accuses Havana and Soviet of Misusing U.N. CUBA WALKS OUT OF O.A.S. COUNCIL

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15-- Emergency aid requests totaling $700,000,000 from eleven Latin-American countries have been rejected by the Agency for International Development since the recent foreign ministers' conference at Punta del Este, Uruguay.

docs.snippet: For the first time in the halfcentury of the inter-American movement, a Western hemisphere government was thrown out of the club last week. In Washington, Cuba was formally excluded from the Council of the Organization of American States.
docs.lead_paragraph: For the first time in the halfcentury of the inter-American movement, a Western hemisphere government was thrown out of the club last week. In Washington, Cuba was formally excluded from the Council of the Organization of American States.

docs.snippet: ROME, Feb. 17--Pope John XXIII nominated today ten prelates who will be elevated to Cardinal at a secret consistory March 19.

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESI Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, Feb. 18 The Soviet Government decleared today that United States policy toward Cuba "creates a serious threat to world peace and security." The accusation was made in a statement reafirming support for Premier Fidel Castro's regime.
